name: audio-merger
title: Audio Merger
description: Combine multiple audio files into one continuous file
content:
Overview

This application merges multiple audio files into a single continuous audio file. Built using pydub, it automatically handles different audio formats and concatenates them in alphabetical order.

Features

  • Merge multiple audio files into one
  • Support for mixed audio formats (MP3, WAV, FLAC, OGG, AAC)
  • Automatic format detection and conversion
  • Configurable output format
  • Files merged in alphabetical order

Parameters

  • Input Directory: Select a stash folder containing audio files to merge
  • Output Format: Select the format for the merged audio file
  • Output Directory: Select or create a stash folder for output

How It Works

  1. Scans the input directory for all audio files
  2. Sorts files alphabetically by filename
  3. Loads and concatenates each audio file in sequence
  4. Exports the merged result in the specified format

Output

The application generates a single merged audio file named "merged_audio" with the specified format extension in the output directory.

Use Cases

  • Combining multiple podcast segments into one file
  • Merging chapter-based audiobooks
  • Creating playlists as single audio files
  • Concatenating multiple recordings
  • Building continuous mixes from separate tracks

Tips

  • Name your files with numeric prefixes (e.g., 01_intro.mp3, 02_main.mp3) to control merge order
  • All files will be concatenated without gaps or crossfades
  • Mixed formats are supported - the app handles conversion automatically
command: rm -rf prod_apps && git clone https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git && apt-get update && apt-get install -y ffmpeg && python "$REPO_DIR/python/audio_merger.py "${inputDir}" -o "${outputDir}" -f "${outputFormat}"
